actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service. H. Rept. 101-643.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 402.
Mr. Sikorski moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Mrs. Morella demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
Subsequently, pursuant to a unanimous consent agreement by Mr. Montgomery, the ordering of the yeas and nays was vacated and the question will be put to a voice vote.
Considered as unfinished business.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Glenn with an amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1022.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: To amend title 5, United States Code, with respect to certain programs under which awards may be made to Federal employees for superior accomplishments or cost savings disclosures, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Makes permanent the provisions governing agency and presidential awards for cost savings disclosures. Revises the method of determining the amount of cash awards for superior accomplishments. Establishes reporting requirements for each agency concerning such awards.

titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, with respect to certain programs under which awards may be made to Federal employees for superior accomplishments or cost savings disclosures, and for other purposes.
